result.execSummary:
The defendant Isis A. Porter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 09/11/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-38

miscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's, during period of probation or civil judgment.
- Restitution is set at zero.
- No firearms/weapons. 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Successfully complete Anger Management, and continue programming.
- Mental Therapy until released by therapist.
- Parenting Class as needed.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No violent contact or discipline with children.
- Maintain employment.

timeConds.notes: *** 9/11/2015, Judge Wagner;  Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence. ***

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isis A. Porter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Isis A. Porter not in court, defendant in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.
for probation review received and filed.

Defendant Isis A. Porter in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Abbey DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO AMENDED COUNTS #1 and #2 (Battery): Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to served 5 MONTHS (CONCURRENT to amended count #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 9 MONTHS.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to served 5 MONTHS (CONCURRENT to amended count #1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 9 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Successfully complete Anger Management, 
   and continue programming.
* Mental Therapy until released by therapist. 
* Parenting Class as needed.  
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No violent contact or discipline with children.   
* Maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero 
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 9-11-2015 AT 1:30 PM. 
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   
EFFECTIVE AUGUST 3, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE HON. JEFFREY WAGNER, BRANCH 38, IN ROOM 504 OF THE COURTHOUSE.  mld

Defendant Isis A. Porter in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Abbey DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon the motion of the State, with the agreement of defense, Court withdraws the plea dated 7-1-2014, and AMENDED the Charges to COUNT #1 and COUNT #2: Battery, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor."  These amendments now make this case a misdemeanor.   mld

Defendant Isis A. Porter in court.  Kristen Schrank appeared for Abbey Marie DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Richard Poulson Jr., appeared this morning to advise that he is currently in trial in branch 10, and would be unavailable for the Sentencing Hearing this afternoon in Branch 4.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-1-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no violent contact, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Isis A. Porter in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is not compliant with the terms of the deferred prosecution agreement.  On motion of the state, Court vacated the agreement and ordered judgments of conviction be entered.  Case is adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-6-2015 at 1:30 pm.  mld

Defendant Isis A. Porter in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Review Hearing on deferred prosecution agreement held.  Defendant is not compliant at this time and has a total of (7) positive drug tests for THC.  State is moving to vacate the agreement.  Court defers on the motion of the State, to allow the defendant to be tested on several more dates, who is maintaining non use of THC at this time.  Court ordered case adjourned for Hearing on the Motion of the State to Vacate the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, calendared in Branch 4 on 3-31-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All bail conditions remain in full effect, per Order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Isis A. Porter in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Mid Point Review hearing proceeded.  Defendant is currently compliant with the terms of the deferred prosecution agreement.  Case adjourned for Review Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-12-2015 at 8:30 am.  mld

Defendant Isis A. Porter in court with attorney Richard E Poulson.  Abbey Desiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to both counts:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction is withheld and the parties enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.  Agreement, received and filed.
Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 4.  Review hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Isis A. Porter in court with attorney Richard E Poulson.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Plea Haring in Branch 4 on 7-1-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Isis A. Porter in court with attorney Richard E Poulson.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  All discovery including an offer letter was turned over to defense counsel from the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 04 on 5-23-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld
Due to ADA assignment case is reassigned to branch 04, Judge Flanagan.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-17-2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Isis A. Porter
Current: 5960 North 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 04-09-2014)
Prior: 5960 North 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.S.M. and C.M.W. Contact is left to the discretion of the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare. Any and all contact with A.S.M. and C.M.W. to be non violent and no corporal punishment.

Defendant Isis A. Porter in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/9/14 @ 1:30pm
